page.title: 04LADYGROVE STUD,PRESTON
page.content: Ladygrove Stud, in Preston,is one of the finest thoroughbred breeding units in Europe.It occupies farm buildings originally designed by Sir Edwin Lutyens in 1904.These were completely restored in 1976 when the stud was established by the present owners.The farm stands in prime pastureland.This, and the climate,produce ideal con_ ditions for breeding horses.The brood mares are often flown to Ireland to be covered but return to Ladygrove to foal.In the special foaling unit they are kept under constant care.Out of the 21 horses owned by the stud,some are undergoing training at Newmarket before being sold.The aim of the stud is to improve the breeding quality and so achieve success on the racecourse.
